Reason: The configuration option _n is performance-sensitive because it directly affects the length of the hash output in the system. The code snippet checks if the hash length is less than _n multiple times during the execution of functions like catena, keyDerivation, and serverReliefClient. This check leads to padding with zero bytes to match the specified length, impacting the overall size of the output. This operation contributes to notable performance variations at the system level.
